availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Champness D. Butler (Taylor County, Kentucky, captain)

body.p: Taylor County, Kentucky, soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Reuben Butler and Sarah E. Carson Butler. Married to Sarah E. Carson in Taylor County, Kentucky, on June 29, 1860. Father of A. C. Butler. Student in Russell County in 1850. Resident of Taylor County in 1861. Served in the 13th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as first sergeant, first lieutenant, and captain from December 30, 1861, to June 27, 1864. Killed in action at Kennesaw Mountain, Georgia, on June 27, 1864.

ab.bibl:
